title: Follow rent/room listings
description: Regularly check room listings on WG-Gesucht, Facebook, Telegram, and university portals.

subtasks.title: Apply to listings and book appointments

title: Prepare application documents
description: Complete documents like SCHUFA, CV, student certificate, declaration form etc. for applications.

title: Complete visa application
description: Book a paid appointment for student/expat visa, upload documents, prepare passport and acceptance letter.

title: Sign rental agreement
description: Sign the digital/physical rental contract upon acceptance and pay the deposit/advance payment.

title: Choose health insurance
description: Research and start mandatory health insurance for students or expats.

title: Register on job portals
description: Register on minijob and student job portals (StepStone, LinkedIn, Indeed).

title: Arrange temporary address
description: If you cannot find a hostel, guest house, or short-term room, arrange a temporary accommodation address.

title: Book appointment for Anmeldung
description: Book a residence registration appointment with the municipality using your rental contract or proof of address.
cityNote: In Berlin, appointments should be booked at least 4-6 weeks in advance.

title: Activate health insurance
description: Get start approval online/branch with your chosen insurance and save your policy.

title: Open bank account
description: Apply to a bank branch or digital bank with your passport and Anmeldung.

title: Buy SIM card
description: Prepare ID/address documents for a prepaid or contract phone line.
cityNote: Most stores in Munich provide support in English.

title: Request Tax ID (Steuer-ID)
description: After completing Anmeldung, apply to the tax office and request a Steuer-ID.

title: Make first job application
description: Send job applications via university, portal, or Facebook group.

title: Join a club/group
description: Check out Meetup, Telegram, student initiatives, or social events and request to join.
cityNote: There are more English events in Berlin.

title: Complete Anmeldung process
description: Go to the municipality on the appointment day; submit address and rental documents to register.
cityNote: Physical documents may be required in some districts of Munich.

title: File insurance/bank documents
description: Add all documents to your digital and physical archive for ease in future applications.

title: Attend interview
description: If you received a positive application response, attend the job interview at the appropriate time.

title: Check working hours
description: Check the weekly or monthly hour limit for Minijobs according to your residence status.

title: Make new friends
description: Build communication/meeting habits with people in WG, school, and social activities.
cityNote: RWTH buddy system exists in Aachen.

title: Check bills/utilities
description: Start contracts and payments for utilities like electricity, internet, and water.

title: Notify address change
description: If you moved to a new address, inform the municipality and bank; update Anmeldung.

title: Track rent/income
description: If you can comfortably pay rent, start budget tracking.

title: Follow permanent housing ads
description: If you stayed at a temporary address, continue applying for new WGs/apartments.
cityNote: It is difficult to find studio rooms in Hamburg.

title: Update insurance policy
description: If you found a job, start insurance through the new employer and cancel the old policy.

title: File Tax ID
description: If you received your Tax-ID/Steuer-ID, save it to your system for both bank and job applications.
cityNote: Mandatory for internship and job applications in Frankfurt.

title: Apply for extra part-time work
description: If income is insufficient, follow extra job listings from other portals and social networks.
cityNote: Freelance and digital work is popular in Berlin.

title: Try to find a mentor
description: Apply to the university's buddy or mentor program or group chats.
cityNote: Mentor systems are common in RWTH Aachen and Berlin.

title: Check bills and payments
description: Ensure you pay rent, utilities, and bills regularly.
cityNote: Payment systems vary in Hamburg.

title: Contract extension/renewal
description: If you stayed in a job or internship, check the end of the contract and start renewal procedures.
cityNote: Internships are short-term in Munich and Frankfurt.

title: Backup all documents
description: Digitally backup all your official documents and papers; create a cloud or physical archive.

title: Active social participation
description: Regularly participate in voluntary, cultural, and social events in the city.
cityNote: Cultural events are very intense in Berlin.

title: Check rent increase and utility costs
description: Take action when there is a significant rent increase or change in utility costs, look for new WG/apartments.
cityNote: There can be raises during the student increase period in Aachen.

title: Focus on German language course
description: Find a course or Sprachcafe to improve your German level, practice for work/life.
cityNote: Free Sprachcafes are available in Berlin and Munich.

title: Check RWTH/Aachen housing portal
description: Complete your application on RWTH dormitories and Studierendenwerk portal.
cityNote: Dormitories fill up early in Aachen.

title: Apply to Studentendorf
description: Complete Studentendorf and Studierendenwerk applications in Berlin in advance.
cityNote: Application period closes early.

title: Digital appointment from Rathaus portal
description: Use stadt.rathaus or stadtverwaltung portal for Anmeldung.
cityNote: There is no digital application in some districts in Munich.

title: Finance/Banking internship application
description: Follow internship listings in major banks in Frankfurt, apply.
cityNote: Finance job listings are dense in Frankfurt.

title: Find English social group
description: Join expat and English-speaking social groups in Hamburg.
cityNote: International groups are active in Hamburg.

title: Try electronic Anmeldung
description: Complete your online application with electronic Anmeldung in Berlin.
cityNote: Digital process has become widespread in Berlin.

title: Join Erasmus/expat club
description: Start membership in RWTH and FH's expat/erasmus communities.
cityNote: These events are physical meetings in Aachen.

title: Monitor rent increase notifications
description: If there has been a high rent increase/expense hike in Munich, look for new WG ads.
cityNote: Raise periods are frequent in Munich.

title: Active participation in expat forum
description: Share Q&A in expat and student forums in Berlin.
cityNote: Berlin expat/student forum is very active.
